Medium: Flatware Silver (soup spoon, fork, knife, dessert spoon, napkin) Presentation box: Silk cover
Heilbrunn Timeline of Art History: Central Europe (Austria, Germany, and Switzerland), 1900 A.D.–present
Description: Czeschka officially joined the Wiener Werkstätte in 1905 and resigned three years later to take a teaching post at the Hamburg Kunstgewerbeschule. He did, however, continue to submit designs and exhibit with the Wiener Werkstätte until 1915, becoming a leading disseminator of the style. The pattern on this flatware is a fine example of the exuberance of Czeschka’s well-documented floral designs for jewelry, metalwork, graphics, textiles, and theater sets and costumes.
Provenance: sale, Christie's, London, King Street, October 28, 2008, lot 44 to Fowler
Jacqueline Loewe Fowler, Stamford, Conn. (2008-10; her gift to MMA)
